title: There’s an easy way for actors to avoid selfie-obsessed fans…
text:
Splenetic 16th-century dramatist and pamphleteer, Robert Greene once wrote: ‘A Cat may looke at a King, and a swaynes eye hath as high a reach as a Lords looke”.

Let that swayne whip out a smartphone and request a selfie with a Dame, however, and it is a very different matter, as a waiter at Brown’s Hotel in Mayfair has discovered.

Brown’s, owned by the hotelier Rocco Forte, was where Dame Emma Thompson was recently having dinner with friends when she was approached by a waiter who asked for a selfie with her.
